answers.answer: Oh and I'm also 4cm dilated 90% effaced
Well first off ur bp is way to high and if ur having headaches he should have been concerned id go to the hosp..
Most docs aren't concerned with blood pressure until the bottom number gets 90 or above. Or 70 and below.
Or top number gets 70 and below*
Swelling in one leg? I've read that's something you should be concerned about... Not trying to scare you, but I feel like he should be treating you better...
I know I've heard a lot of things about being concerned with one leg swelling.  It's like he doesn't care and thinks I'm making it up but HIS nurse took my bp not me?
I would go to the e.r. anyway and see if someone else could give you a second opinion
It makes me.mad because when I do go into the er or l&d they call him and he says if I'm not more than 4cm dilated send me home even with having contractions!!!
Hell no lol I'd be getting a new Dr.
Lol he's my second doctor!
Oh. Well lol I'd cuss his *** out then!

Go in to a diff hospital, is that possible? Or even like an urgent clinic? Because if the doc at the urgent clinic admits you to the hospital there is really nothing the OB doc can say as it was orders from a diff doc.
The nearest hospital is 35 minutes from me. That's the hospital I already am at. So that's not a possibility

Why would he assume you're at risk for a stillborn? Why don't you go to a different hospital to ER where your doctor doesn't visit and they will have no other choice but to call a different on call doctor for that visit
The next nearest hospital is 2 hours away I live in a small town.
Maybe try calling the l&d at the other hospital andsee what they say. Did he test u for pre eclampsia? I mean wow that is rediculous, i feel bad for u.
Headaches bp too high and swelling can be phi and can lead to comolications. I would head to hospital. I had that with my pregnancy but my bp was never that high.

yes, i was tested for pc about 4 weeks ago. my levels were only 86 they have to be 300 plus. so he thought i had mild toxemia which ok.. thanks.. but i check my blood pressure at home, like he told me to do .. and it has been high the past two times.. I do not do anything but sit here with my feet propped up.. so why is it high?

That happened to my sister and she had preclampsia. I don't wanna scare you by any means but it is something to go to the hospital for. They should be able to evaluate you and be able to tell right from the start. They could just need to pump you with fluids. My sisters was so bad and she waited so long she had to have her baby 2 months early. It very well could be nothing but dehydration but you can never be too safe.
Well I drink about 2 quarts of fluids every day..  No soda.. And they've already ruled out preeclampsia... They check every visit for protein so it's not that.

question: I went for a normal.twice a week visit and baby was really hard to find today. He wasn't active at all. I woke up with a headache, major swelling in one leg, mind you my appointment was at 8am, I go there and my blood pressure was 150/84 which is high for me.. I was in the ultrasound room for at least 30 minutes because he wasn't active. So doctor comes in and I ask so can we change my induction to 37 weeks instead of 38?? (Originally 37 weeks for induction) and he brought up well he can have ADHD if born at 37 weeks... Then goes to tell me (a 19 yr old ftm) that I'm still at risk for a still born! Um???? Wow why did you tell me that? He is so fixed on my son being too big but won't work with me? He tells me to come into the hospital (35 minutes away) if i have swelling, headaches and what not but when I see him he isn't concerned? Gosh I just wanna scream at him!!!
title: ob doctor so rude!
